page.description: The {LINE} command draws a thin line vertically or horizontally for the specified number of rows or columns.

argument.name: Columns
argument.description: Numeric. The width of the line in columns.

argument.name: Rows
argument.description: Numeric. The height of the line in rows.

section.title: Example
section.description: The following script shows both vertical and horizontal lines:

The vertical line is created using the {line=0,3} command. This creates a line 3 rows high. The horizontal line is created using the {line=3,0} command. This creates a line 3 columns wide. The '|' commands after the "First Name:", "Last Name:" and "Occupation:" static text controls divides the dialog into three columns.
section.note: This dialog uses the {Region} and {Endregion} commands. It also uses the {sp=number} command to insert a space in the second column.
